review_content: 330ml can from Japan Centre, Soho, London. Definitely one of the stupidest names for a beer that I've seen, lol. Gold + white head. Malty, corny, umami (?), industrial pale lager taste, bit metallic, weirdly boozy for the abv
Sympathique bière, mais sans plus. Goût commun. Pas une surprise malheureusement !
A clean, crisp pale lager, but with a surprising and very pleasant hop bitterness. Nice floral notes.

0.5L can. Thanks to coworker. Clear yellow color with medium foam on top. Foam disappears very quickly. Light yeast aroma. Watery taste at first what is turns medium hops and malt taste. Finish is nice bitter. Drinkable beer.

19 oktober 2019. Nagoya restaurant. Lekkerste bier tot nu toe in Japan. Veel smaak voor Aziatisch bier.

26 oktober 2019. Tokio Taiwanees restaurant. Ook nu: relatief lekker bier.
Toriton, Honolulu: pours gold with a white head. Aroma is grainy, sugary malts. Taste is grainy and pretty sweet. Easy to drink, but bland.

11.08.2019, tap @ Afuri Ramen, Lumine 1 Shinjuku:

Nice fizzy-creamy mediumlasting head, slightly cloudy straw colored. Aroma is slightly dry sour-ish grainy, hay, dried grain, sour grass, minerals, weeds, paper, yeast, tiny hints of banana. Taste is slightly dry sour-ish grassy, hay, weeds, minerals, paper, grass, dried grain, bark. Medium bitterness, slightly harsh grainy mouthfeel. Boring.

From one Japanese grocery, at Paris. Rating and thinking about this beer at home, in Epalinges. Better than the Saigon export, it sounds what it should have to be a real lager, malty, bready, rather dry, a bit water and basic hop, the mouthfeel is ok. Gold body, ordinary carbonation, white foam.
Golden color, small head. Aroma of malt and grassy hops. Dry sweet taste with light bitterness in finish. Typical pale lager, drinkable.
30.03.2019. 0,35l Can. Japan Centre, London. Yellow colour with white head. Aroma and flavours of sweet corn and grain. Low on bitterness. Not good.
Standard pale lager with almost no aroma at all. Slightly unpleasant chemical aftertaste
Offered this beer at Hikari Japanese restaurant where they had it on tap. Reminds me of XXXX which is not a great beee
美味しい、けど大手故の薄さ。香りはその名の通りモルツだが、強くはない。苦味が少なく、後味にキレの良さが目立つ。総じて非常に飲みやすい、癖のないビール。料理の邪魔をしない事は確か、ただこれ単体で飲むのはさびいしいか。
Can pours out straw color topped with a white head. Nose is light corn grain notes a light grass hop. Taste is more of the light corn grain notes and a touch of grass.

Wednesday, September 12, 2018	8:08 PM	
12 ounce can to glass	
Sight: Amber color, hazy, tan head that disappears quickly	
Smell:aroma of malts	
Taste: light bitterness, sweetness	
Feel: medium body, fizzy, 	
Overall: good beer, not to repeat, not to look  for

330ml can from Japan Centre, Soho, London. Definitely one of the stupidest names for a beer that I've seen, lol. Gold + white head. Malty, corny, umami (?), industrial pale lager taste, bit metallic, weirdly boozy for the abv
Sympathique bière, mais sans plus. Goût commun. Pas une surprise malheureusement !
A clean, crisp pale lager, but with a surprising and very pleasant hop bitterness. Nice floral notes.

0.5L can. Thanks to coworker. Clear yellow color with medium foam on top. Foam disappears very quickly. Light yeast aroma. Watery taste at first what is turns medium hops and malt taste. Finish is nice bitter. Drinkable beer.
19 oktober 2019. Nagoya restaurant. Lekkerste bier tot nu toe in Japan. Veel smaak voor Aziatisch bier.…
Toriton, Honolulu: pours gold with a white head. Aroma is grainy, sugary malts. Taste is grainy and pretty sweet. Easy to drink, but bland.
11.08.2019, tap @ Afuri Ramen, Lumine 1 Shinjuku: Nice fizzy-creamy mediumlasting head, slightly cloudy straw colored. Aroma is slightly…

From one Japanese grocery, at Paris. Rating and thinking about this beer at home, in Epalinges. Better than the Saigon export, it sounds what it should have to be a real lager, malty, bready, rather dry, a bit water and basic hop, the mouthfeel is ok. Gold…
Golden color, small head. Aroma of malt and grassy hops. Dry sweet taste with light bitterness in finish. Typical pale lager, drinkable.
30.03.2019. 0,35l Can. Japan Centre, London. Yellow colour with white head. Aroma and flavours of sweet corn and grain. Low on bitterness. Not good.
Standard pale lager with almost no aroma at all. Slightly unpleasant chemical aftertaste
Offered this beer at Hikari Japanese restaurant where they had it on tap. Reminds me of XXXX which is not a great beee
美味しい、けど大手故の薄さ。香りはその名の通りモルツだが、強くはない。苦味が少なく、後味にキレの良さが目立つ。総じて非常に飲みやすい、癖のないビール。料理の邪魔をしない事は確か、ただこれ単体で飲むのはさびいしいか。
Can pours out straw color topped with a white head. Nose is light corn grain notes a light grass hop. Taste is more of the light corn grain notes and a touch of grass.
Wednesday, September 12, 2018 8:08 PM 12 ounce can to glass…
Can sample at a tasting at Max's place. Thanks Yoav. Clear golden, white head. Corn, graininess, some apple, sweetish-bitterish finish.
Pours light golden with a thick white foam. Toast and dry with a pleasant finish.  Pairs well with sushi and sashimi
How does a company that make such good whiskey make such dreadful beer? Watery thin. Lacklustre.

(Draught) Served in a beautiful suntory glass, extremely cold and frosty. Advertised as the 'beer cappucino', this lager had a nice white, foamy persistant head but nothing like eg a Weizen head. Clear, pale yellow colour. Aroma of noble hop. Flavour had some sweet malt and cracker. No significant bitterness. Nice Japanese quaffer, could have kept goibg with a couple more.
A can bought in Shanghai. A basic malt lager with no real taste other than that which comes off lightly when cold.

On tap at The Public Izakaya, Singapore on 11-Apr-2018, served in a glass tanker. Clear golden colour with a one-finger white head. Aroma of grain. Light body and medium carbonation. Sweet and creamy tasting lager.

350ml Can from a Family Mart store in Tokyo (¥142):

This one was a fairly basic but somewhat drinkable offering from Suntory, it's not one that I'd go as far as to recommend anyone tries but it was fairly easy to drink lager with a solid malt taste & some subtle bitterness further on. There wasn't a whole lot to it really but it's not the worst Japanese lager I've tried either.
From the bottle in Japan. Good quality (industrial) beer, refreshing, easy to drink. However, I miss out some more intense flavors that would make it stand out.
Head is soapy. Aroma is spicy and floral. Taste is soapy. Bizarre for a ’premium’ lager.
Big can in a glass. Pours golden with a white head. Aroma of pale malts, light floral hops, and light toast. Flavor the same. Average texture. A decent beer.
Can. Normal lager. Clear yellowish on color. Strong on carbonation. low to middle on bitterness. light to mid on body. Not much on sweetness also. Drinkable

Keg in the lounge at Haneda airport - Tokyo. Pours clear gold with a fluffy, white head. Nice, simple aroma of biscuity malts. Light sweet flavour with further biscuity character, along with soft bitter straw, pale grain. Light bodied with average carbonation. Tidy finish, more dry, pale biscuits, mellow hop presence. No issues here.
0.44ml from tap at Musashi-Kosugi (Tokyo). Just a lager, drinkable but it doesn’t have anything in particular
On tap at Bistro Bingo. Clear yellow-gold pour, two finger white head. Simple corn, yeast and lemon aroma. Very smooth malt taste. Some citrus aftertaste and finishes utterly smooth.
Puszka 0,33 przywieziona z Japonii. Kolor ciemnozłoty, piany brak, aromat nijaki. Typo eurolager (choć spoza euro) niczym się nie wyróżniający, choć też nie jakiś tragiczny.
On tap at restaurant in Canberra. Slight hop nose. Amber beer with creamy white head. High carbonation. Tangy hop taste, bitter finish. Standard Asian lager. Looks good though.
Can - Light grains and some honey. Clear gold with a rich white head. Bitter up front with a touch of grain and apple. Nose is ok but tastes a bit harsh.

Not interested in clocking up ticks, promised myself I’d only rate the really good ones. However, since they’re so widely available in Taipei, and since I actually worked in Japan for five years, I’ll rate this one just for fun. Two small cans from Wellcome supermarket poured into a pint glass for the full effect. Aroma: fresh grass, quite nice actually. Appearance: clear amber, very little head, noticable rising bubbles. Light-bodied, rather thin, lively carbonation, very abrupt bitter finish. Taste: a medium degree of bitterness. For a macro out of a can, this is not the worst by any means. Drinkable.
Bottle in Kyoto. Pours clear pale yellow. Thin and sweet. No depth of flavour. Dry-ish finish.

F: big, white, stable.
C: light pale gold, clear.
A: malt, grainy, caramel, hay, grassy.
T: very malty, grainy, caramel, bread, hint of grassy, medium body, good carbonation, commercial but quite reach rich taste for that, not bad, 35cl can from Tagawa Vleurgat shop in Brussels.
Aroma is butter and peas, some herbs and noble hops. Taste is some herbal malts and tart dryness. Medium finish of more of everything. Ok.
Can. Hazy golden color with small head. Aroma is sweet grains, some hops. Taste is sweet grains, some hops as well. High carbonation. Ok.

500ml can BB 12/2016
Fruity aroma.
Pale straw color with OK head/lacing.
Mild bitterness to start with then a sweet malty finish but thin otherwise.
OK-ish.

On tap at a Japanese restaurant (ramen noodles and grilled skewers ) in Hong Kong. Served with branded glass (the glass was chilled). Golden clolor with a white head (which disappeared very soon). Taste fresh with favour of malt and bread. Easy to drink, no bitterness if finish the drink in around 20 mins (when it is not chilled bitterness favour comes out). Really good accompany with Japnanese food.

0.33 can from somwhere in Tokyo. Appearance is the usual pale, clear and big head. This has also some delicate hops, but it is mainly sweetish. Might work well if cooled and drank in a hot and humid climate.
Tap at Delta Sky Lounge out of a robo machine in Norita. Bright golden pour with a pure white head. Sweet grains. Pretty good palate - slick with some density. Far better than BMC back home.
On tap at Ho Lee Fook. In branded glass. Pours yellow clear with a white head. Only slightly sweet at end. Not bad at all!
Bottle. Clear, golden, light sweetness, lightly bitter, light body, thin feel, average carbonation, & bitter finish.

Pours a pale, clear, gold with a white head that lasts longer than expected but dissipates to a thin ring without too much fuss. Clean pilsner malt aromas, accented by a faint spicy hop note. Flavours are light and of pilsner malt. There’s a carbonic acidity in the late palate and a bitter finish. Light body and a touch of astringency.
Can. A yellow beer with a yellowish head. The aroma has notes of straw and malt. The flavor is sweet with notes of straw and malt, leading to a bitter finish.
Bottle@Yesprs - Golden pour with white head. Aroma and taste is light toasty and sweet malty, with some corn sweetness, some metallic notes, pretty watery and low carb, not allot going on here.
35 cl can. Pours cloudy yellow with a small white head. Aroma is grainy and toasted malt. Dry, flat malty and slight herbal. Dry finish.

Draught. Pale gold with a white head that lasts OK. Aroma of plain bread, light spices. Taste is not going to knock any socks off. Sweet but clean light bready malt, some floral and spicy notes at the slightly bitter finish. Dull but fine (apart from the apostrophe).
How : can Appearance : clear light golden, medium white head. Aroma : bread, caramel, grass. Palate : light /thin body, high carbonation.

L: pours a pale gold with some carbonation bubbles, and a pillowy white head. 
S: a crackery biscuit mustiness, hints of white wine grape. 
T: follows the nose, a tad stale adjunct though, cereal, grain, reasonably nice. 
F: it’s light and clean to drink, lingering flavour of malt to counter the dry finish. Could be livelier in the feel. 
O: I can always down one of these when there are no craft offerings at hand. Simple and quenching.
Can on ANA flight DC to Tokyo. Bright gold body with thin head. Nose quite malty, eggy. Taste is nie and malty. Fresh. Graiy. Quite strong.
Can in HK. drank from can so don’t know appearance. aroma is minimal - some wet grain. taste is slightly sweet malts. grassy finish.
(can) clear pale yellow colour with a tall, white head; aroma starts with noble hops, then cake; balanced, simple and unremarkable flavour with a medium long, light bitter finish

Pour from can, the liquid is amber gold in color and lively. Smells floral. Tastes lightly sweet and somewhat bitter. The finish is also somewhat bitter and long for a lager. It’s a good lager albeit pricey.
350ml can from Japan Centre online shop. Pours clear gold with a thick white head. Aromas of malt, caramel, light lemon. Taste is malt-sweet. Light astringent finish.

Chilled and into a tulip. Strangely misty with a lot of protein caught in suspension. Big, pillowy white head tops a yellow gold body. Low to almost no aroma. Faint starch, boiled rice, lemon peel, spent grain and straw dust. Sweet, slightly milky lactose sweet with a thin body and soft carbonation. Soft lemon tang after a hit of palest malt upfront. Low to no hops and nil for bitterness. Finishes crisp and relatively clean with no aftertaste. Hmmm, a beer that’s like water. Suntory style. Think I liked their Draft 9° more than this, but then this was actually refreshing! (50cL, BBE 12/15, The Bottl’o, East Vic. Park)
33 cl. bottle at a restaurant in Tokyo. Clear golden colour with a white head. Aroma and flavour of malt, hops and floral notes. Not great, but was okay with a meal.

Salaryman beer. No special skill-set at all, it just shows up and works overtime for no reason...just so it doesn’t have to go home. Average beer but better than all of the other macros in Japan. Depressingly good I guess.
Malty and bread aroma and flavor. Maybe a little lemon. Okay bitterness that fills a weak moment. Mediocre beer. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.

산토리 프리미엄 몰츠 5.5% ABV 산토리 생맥 한잔 이천원인 오사카 하치후쿠지(八福神). 캐그 터졌다고 새 캐그에서 거품 나오는거 전부 따라서 마시라고 주셨네요. 지에스25 할인받는 산토리가 언제나 갑입니다 
요즘 한국 맥주대기업들도 일본과 동일한 속도로 소비자 요구에 부응해 마실만한 맥주를 내놓던데,여전히 아쉽게도 산토리가 필스너우르켈을 가지고 들어올때 현지화로 반보 더 걸음을 내 딛던 것관 달리 한국 기업들은 그냥 가지고 오는 것에만 만족하는것 같네요
https://twitter.com/MaekJuBot
Can in osaka. not too bad for one of the macrobrew lagers. slightly sweet, pale amber, mildly bitter finish.

I got this in a can with Japanese writing on it in Taiwan, which is odd. Also, there is an unnecessary and incorrect apostrophe in the name. Everyone needs to know this. This is a really good Pilsner type beer. It is maybe a touch sweeter than I’d like but has a great floral hop character on par with many great Czech examples of the style. This is just a touch heavy across the palate as well which is a shame because it would otherwise be an absolutely excellent beer.
Refreshing, but below expectation. Nothing remarkable. It is overrated. Good carbonation. I don’t like these kind of grainy and metal taste.
Large bottle with dinner at some small shop in Shinjuku. Pours yellow gold with large white head. Nothing remarkable but not a bad drinking beer with food at all.
Exaggerated floral aroma, absent palate, and taste so sweet it tries to gag.

Bottle thanks to Masaki. Pours a clear pale yellow color with a small white head. A light grainy nose. This is a simple clean lager, corn, honey, a touch of earthy malts. Mostly, clean and sweet, watery. Drinkable. Solid for what it is supposed to be.
33 cl. bottle at a Japanese restaurant in Singapore. Clear golden colour with a white head. Aroma and flavour of malt, hops and floral notes.
Lager. Quite sweet. That’s all. 53 characters left... erm... well this is embarrassing.
500ml can pours pale gold with brief frothy head, aroma is fresh & fruity, sweetish smooth taste is malty & refreshing. better than expected

Bottle from The Wine Emporium 030414. The first thing that you notice is how clear this beer is - hold it up and you can see straight through it. Very basic aromas and the flavour is surprisingly not sis bad as expected.

33 cl bottle in Hong Kong, 5.5%, 19 HK$. Gold color, clear, average white head. Quiet nose. Aroma is flowery hoppy, floral with a soapy tone, mild malts, hay. Taste is quite bitter for the style, finish is pretty dry. Somehow resembling a German Pilsener, clean, crisp.

Can (Nagoya). Clear golden color, small white head. Light grainy aroma. Light-bodied. Sweetish corn-like maltyness. Soft palate but somewhat alcoholic or/and acidic. Basic, somewhat clean lager. For relaxing times, make it Suntory time.
Bottled 334ml. -Courtesy of and shared with Marko (thanks!) Yellow/golden coloured, small white head, notes of hay in the nose. Watery, light hoppy and hay with short finish. Could be worse.
A classic average salaryman lager, fairly tasteless and inoffensive as long as you drink it cold enough. Sad but yet drinkable...

Thanks to Jana who brought it from Japan! :) Shared with ogivlado and MatSciGuy. Poured a yellow-golden body with a small white head. Kinda fizzy. Malty aroma, vaguely herbal, some alcohol notes. Creamy malty taste with a fine herbal hopiness. Lacking bitterness. Better lager than expected, but not entirely my type.

22oz bottle at a restaurant in Tokyo 

Clear golden with a small white head and some lacing. Aroma of sweet malts, hay and honey. Flavors is malty and straw 

A decent lager
w zapachu słody i lekki ruski szampan. kolor złoty, przejrzysty, piana skąpa, ale się trzyma. w smaku pełne, słodowe z lekkim posmakiem kartonu i dość słabą goryczką.
Lata de 33 cl. Color dorado. Sabor a malta, ligero, ligeramente amargo. Buena cerveza comercial

Pours a thin head with low retention on a clear light straw colored body.
The aroma is candy corn... not good.
The taste leads with metallic bitterness followed by candy sweetness. 
The texture is sticky with moderate carbonation.
Too sweet, not good.

From can in Narita, Japan. Pours golden with a thin white head. Aroma of grains and hay. Taste is grains and hay, light to medium bitter. Thin mouthfeel. Medium carbonation. This beer has a hoppy character that separates it from many of the other readily available beers.
caramellite, toast, bread, floral, herbs, citrus, leaves, dough, alcoholly, banana, clove,
140114. Can at lodge, Niseko, Japan. Pours clear golden with a high frothy head. Aroma malts, butter. Light palate. Slightly sweet.
~This review was made some time ago via another application, and thus the specific details (beyond numerical scores) are no longer available~

Bottle to plain glass
Our first beer on our Japanese tour. Not very excited about this one, but after 24 hours of traveling, I'll do my best. It's accompanying some sushi, so I won't complain too much.
Aroma of grains and hay and horse piss. Bright clear amber with no discern able head. The taste is disgusting; I don't have the words right now.
Faint malty aroma. Ok malty taste without unpleasant flavors. Simple and somewhat elegant. Easy to drink.

A microbrew wannabe. But not necessarily a bad thing. One of my favorites to grab from Family Mart in Taiwan when I can't get to a proper beer. A noticeable amount of hops is put in there for a large brewery. A lot better than the rest of the crap found in convenience stores here. But maybe I've lived here too long. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Can: Aroma is malty with grassy hops. Pale golden color, low white head. Flavor is crisp, malty, few sweet with a nice grassy hop finish. Light to medium bitter Quite good beer.

Appearance: Clear golden, good amount of white head.
Aroma: Floral, some hops and malt.
Taste: More floral, herbs? And of course malt and hops. Standard.
Info: 334ml bottle, 10/6-2013

Another bland Japanese lager, available everywhere on draft and often the 200-300 yen beer as nama. Pours a pale fizzy yellow with a white head. Cold no aroma & not much flavor. As it warms up some grass, hay, grain notes show up but be sure to finish the glass before it gets too warm or it’ll be pretty bad. Drinkable but only just.

looks between yellow and golden with minimal head. smells slightly of noble hops, clean, light malt. taste is a very clean, light maltiness and honey taste but generally balanced towards neutrality/slight bitterness. some herbal, spicy hops. it’s got a nice full body. faultless and a good beer, too bad they charge way too much for it

Pours gold. Foaming with head. Aroma of straw, and bitter malts. Taste has a good bite, sweet grainy flavor and good bitterness. The sweet grassiness and a bit of alcohol are no bueno, nor is the gummy sweet finnish. This beers only saving grace is its bitterness.
Clear golden coloured beer with small white head and new carbonation. Malty herby aroma. Full sparkling palate. Finish is malty bitter.

Can tnx to Jaime. Pours clear pale amber with a nice white head leaving laces. Aroma is malty hoppy grassy a bit citric fruity and soapy. Flavor is acidy fruity a bit sweet bitterish malty. Not my cup of tea.

Canned, thanks to larsniclas. Somewhat pale yellow beer with a small white head. Malty glue aroma, bready, sweetish, some hay. Malty bready flavor, watery, some rather bad strange bitterness. Harsh bitter finish with fruits and bread.

330ml can; Explosive two-finger head with lasting crumpet-like white foam; Small lacing with notable carbonation. Good aroma of malt, bread and slightly herbal hops; Minimally sweet taste of malt, with bread, citrus and grassy hops; Medium body, oily palate; Taste profile is decent bready malt with very notable citrus and grass throughout, in a orangy background somewhat vaguely resemble a Pale Ale. Interesting! Sweetness is very, very low, a good feature; Hoppiness is pretty strong for a premium lager, very citreous and increasingly bitter through not that astringent, finishing is a bit numbing but not unpleasant. Quite dry after taste, easy to mouth.



Comments: I finally got the chance to try out a brand which is readily available in HK. As a full-malt beer (expensive by Japanese standards), this one is a very solid premium lager - good aroma, no skunky cat-piss malt, very nice head and frothy, expressive hops which contribute a Pale Ale-like palate with mild but penetrating bitterness. A rare feats for Japanese macros, and put many global macros to shame. The slightly expensive import price is justified. Recommended.

Smooth and sweet malts, then a touch of bitterness. Clean and crisp while still effervescent but flattens quickly, and there is a jarring taste of alcohol heat at the finish. Drinkable but not something I’d ask for again.
Can. Clear golden color, medium white head. Aroma of grassy straw. Taste is bitter and plain.
Can. Clear yellow colour with a white head. Aroma of malts, hops. Flavour is grain, sweet malt.
Not bad, within the context of Japanese lagers for the masses. No aroma, but nice, crisp and bitter. Justifiably a pilsener, as the label says.
gold blond colored body with a white head and a spicy hoppy flavor with a spicy hoppy bitter sweet taste with a bitter finish

On tap at the brewery tour. Far, far better than from a can. Thick creamy head, delicate carbonation. Light to medium mouthfeel, but much stronger and more balanced flavours than most Japanese macros. Malt is strong but nit overpowering. Nice citrus notes. My favorite mainstream Japanese beer.

Canned, bought at a local store in Seoul, Korea. Shared with Wim and Yves. Golden blond coloured beer with a small white head and a sweeter light malty hinted aroma. Medium to light palate. Finish is sweeter pilsener malty. Rather ok actually for a lager, but nothing to special.

A 100% malt beer and rather expensive.That’s due to Japan’s taxing of Barley malt! Don’t get me started on this insane issue!!  This beer is known for it’s smooth rich taste and yes it does taste good. A very light hop delivery and a head that is sadly very short lived maybe worse than some low malt competitors. Some taverns offer a discount with a purchase of a pitcher.
I give it a thumbs up on taste alone...but  not real exciting.
Tap@SomeRestaurantTokyo. Nice clean lager with a distinctive German bottom fermented character.
Pour medium yellow with a big white head.  Traces of malt aroma.  Noticeable malt taste.  Lots of carbonation.  Not bad as a mass produced lager.  But cannot compare with a decent craft beer.

Found at the local Family Mart. Probably one of the better beers to buy in China. Extremely cheap. Not sure why it’s labeled as Premium because it’s still very low on the tast factor. Suitable for crushing....

December 6th, 2010 - Beer blogs and certain brewers will be eager to tell you about the gains made in the civil war waging in Japan. No, the Boshin sensou hasn’t re-ignited, but their is a battle of wits and laws and economics being waged, and the prize is the hearts, minds and guts of Japan’s affable quaffers. One of the keystones of the macrobrewers is the Suntory Premium Malts - unfortunately, it is the Lexus of the beer aisle at 7-11 or Suntory’s, in price and prestige. In all fairness, the taste is fuller, thicker, pairing that universal pale lager bitterness with genuine malt and wheat flavors, and even soft touches of puffed rice. The color too suggests substance - deep and golden like a cider. Still, it is a lot to pay for a minute improvement, and when you’ve just given up the whole beer drinking hobby in Japan in favor of munching kaki no pea and drinking sake, the financial disincentives are too strong. I hope that this standard bearer of luxury is knocked on the side of its head, and that one of Japan’s many aspiring craft brewers can show the islands what a good beer is for (even if it costs a couple hundred yen more.) That will be the kind of beer where you can forget your socio-economic or demographic woes, or even better, ponder fixes for them. The Suntory Premium Malts? A relic of an age who’s time is passing in America, and who’s time may also pass on the other side of the Pacific Ocean.
Cheesy aroma, malts. Appearance is golden. Taste is full, malts. At first, palate is sharp but disappears really fast. A good beer.

Brown bottle in Hong Kong (334mls) as "The Premium Malts Suntory Pilsner Beer" (5.5%  ABV). A golden beer with a small short lasting lasting white head. Nose of sweet golden malts and little else. Flavours are similar with a light hop presence. Reminds me of Crown Lager in Australia sold as a "premium lager" in a similarly shaped bottle.

500ml Can. Pours yellow-gold with a thick white head, that quickly dissapears. Smells cheesy yeast, with some caramel malts. Tastes lively with strong cheesy yeast, some citrus hops and a small amount of caramel malt. Altogether not a bad lager.
Poured from bottle pale yellow color. Aroma of citrus, hops, grassy with a little caramel. not a bad every day beer.

Bottle - Pale yellow gold with a thick creamy lacy head. Smells of citrus hops, fruit and sweet malt with some lemon grass. Grainy dense medium body. Taste of malt and a light fruitness with a bitter dry hop aftertaste. Nice balance with a decent amount of malt. Though this is one of the best of the mega produced beers its still not that wonderful.

(on tap) Clear golden with good head. Pleasant aroma. Nice mouthfeel, light body but not watery, with nice carbonation. The flavour is slightly disorienting. It has some decent matliness and it has some nice hoppiness and there is some bitterness in the finish, but it somehow doesn’t seem quite right, as though the separate parts of the flavour have been isolated, tweaked and then put back together. Overall this is definitely drinkable, and compares well with mainstream beers in the region, but is somehow a little odd.
Why anyone would make a song and dance about this beer is a bit of a mystery. Just pale and samey-samey malts and aromas as just about every Euro-like lager out there. Just unremarkable all over.
Pours like a pale lager. Smells and flavors consist of some floral hops and caramel malt. Light bodied with a slightly bitter finish. Overall not too bad, I’d drink it again.

500ml bottle at home from the local offie. Pale blond colour, very clear, white bubbly head soon fades. Aroma is light caramel, grassy, citrus hops, and wheat. Taste is slightly sweet, some bitterness, nice and malty. Nice and crisp. For some reason I have had a soft spot for this for quite a few years now. Can’t really explain why, but it is one of the better macro lagers.
33,4cl bottle at The Bier Bar in Kuala Lumpur. Light golden with a white head. Malty aroma with caramel and hints of hops. Sweet and malty, but quite drinkable in the heat. (2012-05-04)
Can in the CBD Melbourne. Malty and well-bodied pale lager. Aromas of wet leaves and hay. Taste is sweet, with average length. Palate is velvety, and medium bodied. Yellow, with disappearing head.
(330ml can)  Pours a clear pale yellow body with a small white head.  Aroma of corn and butterscotch.  Flavor of grain, grass, and dough with a mildly bitter finish.
can . golden colour with white head . aroma is malty and grassy / hoppy . taste is sweetish malt  with a touch of bitterness at the end. lively carbonation  .
Bottled at Christchurch, NZ. Clear Pale golden colour. Quite awfull taste, acid and malty. Maybe too old bottle?

Can from local supermarket (Izumiya). This is the re-launched version, with deep blue lettering on the can. Soft malt with grassy pils aroma and mild touch of hops. Clear straw color. Persistent, lively carbonation with a constant quarter-inch of foam.Light bready flavor, salt & sugar, Very smooth transition to a light bitter final. Thin body with light carbonation. One of the better mass market macro lagers in Japan -- more body, aroma, and flavors than most have. I wonder about the punctuation in the name: "Malt’s"  = malt is? or malt was? or malt has (something)?...

Bottle at 37 Curry in Tokyo. Deepish yellow colour, relatively full bodied, malty and a bit sweet, short finish. Not great but one of the better Japanese macro brews I’ve had.

Rerate on tap in Ippudo, Tokyo. Fresher, actually had a nice bitter hop finish.

Can on JAL flight 402 from Heathrow to Tokyo. Colour is clear amber, with a little tinge of orangeness. Nose is strong straw, dry grass, and grainy sweetness. Taste is grain malt sweetness, touch of metallic and a crisp lager bitter tang.

Can (rated Apr 2008).

Head is mostly diminishing.
Body is medium yellow.

Aroma is lightly to moderately malty (toasted grain), lightly to moderately hoppy (flowers, herbs), with a hint of lemon zest.

Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly bitter.
Finish is lightly sweet, moderately bitter.

Medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation.

Aromatic, flavorful, balanced, clean.  Very good example of a lowly pale lager...I think I actually drank the whole can.  After having this and the regular Malt’s, plus a bunch of other macro Japanese lagers from Sapporo, Asahi, and Kirin, it would seem Suntory is the best of the swillin’ breweries.
Yellow body, white head. Aroma of malty alcohol and almond. Flavour has intense alcohol almondyness. Hints of citrus, but just a little bit.

Had this one before at Ken’s. Pours a frothy head which disappears quickly. Colour is as expected, golden but unfortunately it was served in a cold glass which I dont like. Malty aroma. Smooth initial taste and strong aftertaste slightly acidic and cardboardy. Not memorable or terribly exciting. Would be a great summer drink.

Can, Chez Martin, Yonago, Japan. Lime gold with a generous, spittle-like foam collapsing fast. Some surprising grassy and herbal hop, almost lemon peel or parsley notes. Bathfoam, powdered coriander-like aroma. Biscuit linger. Decent for a tinned J macro I suppose. And at the current exchange rate about £20 a sixpack.

Good lager. Pours yellow with quickly dissipating head. Nose is malt ( gasp) and sweet. Taste is again malt and sweet with a herbal bitter aftertaste. Elements of toffee and nut can be found. Finish is quick yet crisp. I’m  a massive fan of Japanese lagers and I didnt drink this for ages as the can and name put me off. I can see myself drinking this from the 7-11 when I’m in the mood for something with more bite than Super Dry. Stronger than most Jap beers with a bitter edge, but seems sweeter on draught and doesn’t taste as herbally as the can( had it in many a yakitori place in Tokyo). The more I drink this the more I enjoy it.

Enjoyed this the other night at my favourite Japanese yakitori restaurant in Adelaide. Went very nicely with Black Angus beef sashimi. A good, malt driven lager, one of the better mega-brewed lagers from Japan.
Saw it as a Japanese lager and avoided it for a long time for the same reason.  Actually has a decent hoppy head and an unpleasant finish.  Tall can.

350 ml can. From Malaysia.

Clear pale golden colour with tiny white head.
Malt in soda like aroma.
Almond, malt and mild alcohol. Some unpleasantness. 
Not very good.
Draught on 27/6/11. Thick white head an golden colour. Malty and served very cold. Boring.

Can. Golden, small and fully diminishing head. Light to moderate, malty and sweetish aroma, some fruitiness and grassy hoppyness, some diacetyl. Light to moderate body, malty and sweetish flavor, some fruitiness and alcohol, grassy hoppyness. Finish is average, malty and lightly sweetish, grassy hoppyness. Malty and sweetish lager...

Bottle from local Asian market.  Clear piss yellow with light piss head.  Nose is honey and sugar and hay.  Apples.  Taste is sweet grass and hay to honey and white sugar.  Barley and hops out back.  Better than Budweiser, but only just.  I’d drink it out of an ice chest at the lake if  Iwere needing a beer to stave off the impending hangover, but I’m not, because I’m not, so I won’t.  Hope the fish at the end of the sewer system enjoy the pour.

Flowery hoppy nose.
Hazy golden creamy head.
Light body, light hay, flowery.
Hoppier than the other premium beer.
Draft. A generously malted lager. The result of which is perhaps a sweetness a bit much for my palate.

On draught machine at 
United Airline’s lounge at Narita airport. Pours a clear gold with thick white head. clean aroma with slight hops presence. Moderate carbonation with fine bubbles. Early mild hops bitterness followed by soft hoppy flavor paired with mellow pale malt. No big rice notes or dry finish. Actually very tasty.

Fresh on tap at the Kumamoto brewery. Quite different from canned/regular tap versions. Hop flavor is much more pronounced and tastes fresher. Actually quite a nice beer at the brewery, and you’re allowed three glasses of it after the free brewery tour. Canned version is around a 2.6.

0,33 literes dobozos kiszerelés. Gyorsan elszálló hab alatt világos arany test. Illatában a maláta uralkodik, melyet megtör egyfajta kovász aroma. Ízére szintén a kenyér ízű maláta jellemző melyhez kissé édeskés szőlőhéj íz kapcsolódik, s ezt az egészet körbefonja egy keserű komlósság.

Tap and bottle.  Light gold pour with pretty long lasting white head.  Light on the nose - grass and some spice.  Light body but nice balance of bitterness, sweetness and malt.  Goes well with Japanese raw fish.
(can) medium gold with white head. Malt aroma with a hint of grassy hops. Flavor is biscuit malt with a bit of hops in the finish.
Barely any nose...grass thats it. Appearance is non-descript. Flavour is sour. Premium nothing.

Pale gold, small white head, dusty surface cover with some spotty lacing. What the hell is this???? Doesn’t really smell like beer.. stolen description: citrus spice dust. Sour, drinkable but not really beerish. Odd grain? Touch of apple, lightly spiced hops, taste is getting better... orange.... well I guess this ain’t terrible. Decent finish with a short bitterness.

Japnese beer rating at Tiddes, sponsor Kras, 2009-11-27, can
AP: golden, high white head.
AR: malt, hops, herbs
F: malt, hops, herbs

Appearance: Yellow with gold tint.
Aroma: Slightly floral with grapefruit rind--not very aromatic.
Flavor: Light-medium malt with some bready/yeasty character.  Moderately sweet fruit (ripe orange) plus bitter grapefruit rind.

Comment: The palate shows a nice initial attack of malt, bittering and carbonation followed by a little sweet malt with the flavor rapidly fading on the finish.  What little malt/hop integration there is quickly falls apart as it warms even just a bit.  A sign of a not very well-made beer.
Can at Shinjuku City Hotel NUTS. Clear amber - white head. Sweet malty, light roasted, light nutty, light hoppy, light bitterness, caramel, peppery, spicy notes, light citrus. Plain - and light.

50 cl can from Japan (thanks Dad!), served cold in a tulip glass. JL 24/09.



App.:  Clear, golden with a fair, white, creamy head.
  
Aroma:  Light grain and cereal, some very light grassy, peppery hops.
  
Palate:  Medium body and carbonation.
  
Flav.:  Quite light, a little vague fruitiness, grain and cereal, a bit of grassy/peppery hops; dry with a little bitterness.



Kinda boring.

Poured from a can.  Appearance is a nice looking deep golden color with a white head.  Smells of malts and some hops.  Tastes slightly sweet and grassy, not bad at all.  Not too thin, but goes down pretty easy with no unpleasant flavor.  One of the better asian macros or macros in general for the matter.
Pours a deep golden color with  white head.  Aroma is pilsner malts, honey, fruity, and peppery hops.  Flavor is malty, honey, slightly fruity, a nice peppery finish.

Had this on tap at the Kyoto brewery, which means this review will be much better that you are likely to find this beer anywhere else. It had a thick, fine, creamy head that you could almost walk on. Aroma was dominated by rich lemony hops. Malt flavor is as good as you get for a Japanese macro, and aroma hops are there in force. Palate works well. Everything was decent, although I was still wishing for a bit more bitterness. The hops are used almost only for aroma. Far better than in the can. Free too!  
Actually, I would say that this is a premium lager, as it is carefully lagered for a good deal of time.
350ml Can – Honolulu, Hawaii – A nice rice lager.  Easy drinking had some flavor and overall was pretty tasty.

Where asahi fails to get anything right, Suntory seem to be one of the better macro brewers in Japan.  

Some people seem to be confused with aroma and taste on this one.  Taste being 60/70% smell that’s perfectly understandable. For me it has an intense wheat nose with some pollen thrown in.

Low carbonation, quite easy to drink with a bitter aftertaste.

Keeps a nice looking head, even after the initial pour. I prefer the original suntory malts but this does the business aswell.
Nice nose here...zesty, bitter lemon. taste is quite solid for a big company brewer. Malty & chewy with a well balanced bitter finish. One of the best "after bath beers" you’ll find from a can.

A golden lager with a huge unctuous frothy white head. Aroma of malt is lightly herbal hops. In mouth, plenty of biscuitty malts with German hopping, very grainy and chewy. Overall, quite interesting. Medium bodied. Can from Japan, from a colleague, Nov. 2007.
I like this beer quite a lot, it’s probably one of the best Japanese beers out right now.
Pale lager, quite full taste. OK balance between malt and hops, but there is a madical edge and a metallic finish.

Thanks to Capa for this brew.  Pours a golden color with a white head.  Not really much to the aroma but is mostly sweet malts, grassy tones, and a slight hint of some hops.  Flavor is lighter with plenty of the sweet malts and grass with a little hop presence.  Definitly better then most pale lagers.

Draft @ Brewery: Pours a yellow color with a nice puffy white head and lots of lacing. The nose is malty, nice sweet fresh malts, a bit of husk and fairly up forward hops. The flavor is clean and malty, nice and fresh. Thanks Satoshi!
Aroma is grainy with some hops in the bunch.  This beer tasted the closest to any pilsener that I could find in Japan.  Clean taste, nice hops.

The aroma is so faint and uninteresting that I just don’t care. The palate, however, really struck me. It is oily, but also much creamier than other Japanese macros I have consumed. That’s all that I could really note. Everything else is nothing to rave about - airy, soapy head that leaves some random lacing; nearly dead, translucent bronze-yellow body; the hops seem to play near the finish, and I did like actually it, which then helped me note the aroma.

Can.  Pours clear golden (suprise, suprise) with a frothy white head.  Aroma is malty and a bit of hop citrus.  Flavor is more hops bitterness than normal pale lagers I’ve had.  Malts as well.  Finishes with a little dry bitterness from the hops, and a metallic tinge.  Better than most beers I’ve had in this style.

350 ml. can. Pours golden with smal foamy head. Thin malty aroma with a little bit of hop spice. Suprisingly bitter and a little buttery. Some pilsnery hop flavors, but not that complex. Body is a bit thin, but there is almost no adjunct flavor. A little bit of metallic aftertaste.

[on tap]
Nice fresh noble hops aroma combined with sweet malt and a lemony finish.  Bright gold with a lasting white sheet that formed pretty lacing.  Delicate DMS-y (in a good way) malt with the perfect balance of bitterness.  More malt than hops in this beer.  Light body with medium carbonation and a clean finish.

Clear golden color with a white, lasting head.  Sweet, malty aroma.  Certainly a predominantly malty beer in terms of the flavor.  A bit of hoppy bitterness somewhere in there.  "Premium", of course, is something of a subjective/relative term.  The body is very light, but not too thin or watery.  I would say that this beer, compared to most Japanese macros, is "premium", simply because there are no obvious traces of corn, rice, or other adjuncts.  Other than that, this is nothing special.  And a bit too expensive for what it is.
Probably the best Japanese beer available from a macro. A little sweet and quite satisfying.
Tap @ Rose & Crown Victorian pub, Shinjuku, Tokyo. Pale lager with surprisingly good citrussy hop presence in nose & taste.

Poured with some head and lace. Head mostly fades. Very pale yellow. Light bitter beer nose. Very carbonated. Too much in fact. Sweeter than it smells. Thin. Forgetful. Got it at a nearby quick mart in a 640 ml bottle that I’m trying in my hotel room in Shanghai now. Which it was a smaller bottle.

Can. Golden with a medium fairly lasting white head. Sweet aroma of malt with some fruitiness. Flavour is fresh and clean, nice maltiness with some fruitish hops. Finish is a little bitter.  An very tasty all malts beer!
Can. Pale gold, white head. Aroma is sweet and malty. Flavor is malty and on the hoppy side.
Orange tinted yellow. Thin quickly diminishing head. Seems more Pilsener in style than pale. Strong hops on a dry body.
